description.undefined: GDPRov is an OWL2 ontology to express provenance metadata of consent and data lifecycles towards documenting compliance for GDPR.

comments.undefined: PROV and P-Plan extension for representing provenance of consent and data lifecycles. Created by Harshvardhan J. Pandit and Dave Lewis.

abstract.value: The upcoming General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) requires justification of data activities to acquire, use, share, and store data using consent obtained from the user. Failure to comply may result in significant heavy fines which incentivises creation and maintenance of records for all activities involving consent and data. Compliance documentation therefore requires provenance information outlining consent and data lifecycles to demonstrate correct usage of data in accordance with the related consent provided and updated by the user. GDPRov (pronounced GDPR-Prov) is a linked data ontology for expressing provenance of consent and data lifecycles with a view towards documenting compliance. GDPRov is an OWL2 ontology that extends PROV-O and P-Plan to model the provenance.

comment.undefined: Is an activity dealing with data breach.

comment.en: A DataErasureProcess is responsible for handling the data erasure of a data subject.

comment.undefined: The process or series of steps that handle the right to transparency.
Direct Marketing where the marketing is done directly to the data subject.

comment.en: A ThirdPartyDataController is a Third Party entity that acts as a Data Controller

comment.undefined: Represents data that has been Anonymised at some level reflected by the hasAnonymityLevel object property
A Representative of the Controller

label.undefined: Handle Right to basic information about Processing

comment.undefined: The process or series of steps that handle the right to basic information about processing.

comment.en: A ThirdParty is any external entitiy associated with some internal activity

comment.undefined: Is an activity that collects or acquires data.

comment.en: ConsentWithdrawalStep deals with withdrawal of consent

comment.undefined: Is an activity that notifies controller about data breach

comment.en: A DataUsageStep is a DataStep that uses existing data present within the system

comment.undefined: Is an activity that modifies given consent.
Is an activity that withdraws given consent. Can also term it so as to depict withdrawal as a modification of consent.
Represents the Terms and Conditions entity.

comment.en: DataStorageStep stores data within the system

comment.undefined: The process or series of steps that handle the right to restrict processing.

comment.en: A DataAccessProcess corresponds to the request made by an user for access to their data within the system. This process is responsible for handling the request process and providing the appropriate data to the end user.

comment.undefined: Is an activity that acquires consent.

Personal data revealing racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religious or philosophical beliefs, or trade union membership, and the processing of genetic data, biometric data for the purpose of uniquely identifying a natural person, data concerning health or data concerning a natural person's sex life or sexual orientation.
Represents a personal data entity.
A Processor appointed under or by another Processor is a Sub-Processor.
A Joint Controller is where two or more controllers jointly determine the purposes and means of processing.
Reflects the process(es) used to appoint processors
The process or series of steps that handle the right of data portability.
Is an activity dealing with consent.
Is an entity acting as the user identifier. Or contains an identifier.
The process or series of steps that handle the right to rectification of personal data.
Step that notifies the Data Protection Authorities of a data breach.
The process of monitoring compliance as mandated by the GDPR.
Step that notifies the controller of data breach.

comment.en: A DataRectificationProcess describes the process of data rectification, which is the correction of data already present within the system

comment.undefined: Is the template used to obtain the given consent.
A process that defines the actions that should be undertaken in event of a data breach

comment.en: Represents class of data collected or generated through various activities

comment.undefined: Is an activity that archives data. Archival is transformation of data into some form for storage.
A representative of the Processor.

comment.en: A DataStep deals with data

label.undefined: Handle Right to not be evaluated through Automated Processing

comment.undefined: The process or series of steps that handle the right to not be processed automatically.
Rectifies existing data

comment.en: ConsentArchivalStep archives acquired consent to form a record of the consent given by the user.

label.undefined: Handle Right to Object to Processing

comment.undefined: The process or series of steps that handle the right to object to processing.

comment.en: ConsentAcquisitionStep deals with acquiring consent from the user. It uses Terms and Conditions along with the appropriate Consent Model as the basis of obtaining consent from the user. The output of this step is the consent object agreed upon by the user.
A ConsentStep acts/interacts with/uses Consent

comment.undefined: Is an activity that stores data.
A step that provides the data subject with a copy of their personal data.
Is an activity that deletes or erases data.

comment.en: DataDeanonymisationStep deanonymises data by transforming it from one form to another along the anonymisation chain.
ConsentModificationStep deals with modifications to the consent by the user. It invalidates the previous consent object and produces a new updated consent object that represents the modified consent.
DataArchivalStep archives data by transforming it and storing it

comment.undefined: Is an activity that deanonymises data.

comment.en: A ConsentWithdrawalProcess deals with the withdrawal of consent by the user and the corresponding activity carried out within the system

comment.undefined: Is an activity that anonymises data.
Is an activity that recitifies data.

label.undefined: An activity that archives given/acquired consent for storage.

comment.en:
DataAnonymisationStep anonymises data by transforming it from one form to another along the anonymisation chain.
Anonymisation can be represented as a spectrum going from raw user data to pseudo-anonymised data that can be de-anonymised by the same agent/organisation to pseudo-anonymous data that cannot be deanonymised internally, but may be done by external agents who have access to other data, and finally to completely anonymised data.

PersonalData is any data pertaining to the user which can contain personally identifiable information or a data set generated by the system using personally identifiable information acquired through direct or indirect means

comment.undefined: Reflects cross-border transfer of data
An individual or entity

comment.en: A ThirdPartyDataProcessor is a Third Party entity that acts as a Data Processor

comment.undefined: Is an activity that transfer data across borders (as defined in the GDPR).
Provides a way to express the Anonymity Level of AnonymisedData objects through the object property hasAnonymityLevel
Marketing as a process or collection of steps.
Represents the given consent by the data subject.
Is an activity that transforms data.
Is an entity containing sensitive personal information.
A record of a data breach.

comment.en: An UserIdentifier is a specific way to identify the user through a unique ID or a combination of other attributes

comment.undefined: The process of reporting after a data breach has taken place.
Is an activity that uses data. Can also be termed as 'Processing' of data.
Is an activity that shares data.

comment.en: ConsentAgreement reflects the consent provided by the user based on the provided Terms and Conditions and Consent Agreement Templates. It is the set of permissions the user has specifically provided or refused to provide. This consent is useful to provide justification of activities that use user data.
DataSharingStep shares data with another agent/organisation. These may be internal or external entities.

comment.undefined: Is an entity where personal data has been anonymised to some extent.

comment.en: A Process describes a 'Plan' of action for carrying out a particular activity that uses or is related to Data or Consent
DataTransformationStep transforms data from one form into another.

comment.undefined: Represents a data entity.
The process or series of steps that handle the right of erasure.

comment.en: A DataArchivalProcess describes the process of data archival

comment.undefined: Impact Assessment for the organisation

comment.en: Terms and Conditions of usage as provided to the user in agreement of provided service

comment.undefined: Is an activity that notifies data subjects about data breach

label.undefined: Handle Right to Object to Direct Marketing

comment.undefined: The process or series of steps that handle the right to object to direct marketing.
The Data Protection Officer appointed to an organisation.

label.undefined: Handle Right to access Personal Data

comment.undefined: The process or series of steps that handle the right to access personal data.

comment.en: DataCollectionStep collects data from the user
This is a template for consent requested from the user.

comment.undefined: Step that notifies the data subject of data breach.

comment.en:
DataDeletionStep deletes data from within the system;
The deletion is expressed as prov:invalidated over the dataset.

comment.undefined: Is an activity that notifies data protection authorities about data breach
Step representing an action associated with data breach.
Is an activity involving data.
Shares data with a third party
Links a Consent Acquisition Step with the Terms and Conditions presented to the user when acquiring Consent
links a Consent Acquisition Step with the Consent Agreement Template used to acquire consent
Indicates that an DataAnonymisationStep transforms a Data object into AnonymisedData
Generates ConsentAgreement which is a the consent granted by the user based on the ConsentAgreementTemplate through a ConsentAcquisitionStep
links step with data used
justifies use of data by step through specified consent agreement
Links data obtained (collected) by the step/activity that acquired it
Indicates the anonymity level of an AnonymisedData object using instances of the AnonymityLevel class
Indicates sharing of Data through a DataStep
produces data
